messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project aim to do?

The ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project aims to create loaders for diffusers format checkpoint models, making it easier for ComfyUI users to use diffusers format checkpoints instead of the standard checkpoint formats.
How does the CombinedDiffusersLoader support loading of diffusers checkpoints?
The CombinedDiffusersLoader supports loading of diffusers checkpoints for SD 1.5, SD 2.1, SDXL, SD3, AuraFlow, Flux, and supports loading via extra_model_paths.yaml using ComfyUI.
What are the limitations of the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader?

The ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader currently lacks support for other compatible diffusers format checkpoints, such as HunyuanDiT and PixArt. It also experiences an OOM issue when using default weight_dtype for Flux.
What are the future improvements for the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader?

Future improvements include adding support for other compatible diffusers format checkpoints, such as HunyuanDiT, PixArt, and Kolors. It is noted that these additions would require raising a PR on the main comfyUI repo. Additionally, the project aims to improve compatibility with Flux by avoiding the use of default weight_dtype due to an OOM issue.
What are the steps to install and set up the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project?

To install and set up the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project, users should follow these steps:
1. Download the node via ComfyUI-Manager by searching for DiffusersLoader and add it to their workflow.
2. Add nodes to their workflow by selecting Add Nodes -> DiffusersLoader -> Combined -> CombinedDiffusersLoader.
3. Connect the DiffusersLoader to their workflow.
What is the CombinedDiffusersLoader supported by?
The CombinedDiffusersLoader supports loading of diffusers checkpoints for SD 1.5, SD 2.1, SDXL, SD3, AuraFlow, and Flux. It also supports loading via extra_model_paths.yaml using ComfyUI.
Who is the author of the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project?
The author of the ComfyUI-DiffusersLoader project is Hafiz Saffie, who can be contacted at hafiz.safs@gmail.com.
